data.title: De Jong Cees W, First Edition
data.meta_description: Sans Serif : The Ultimate Sourcebook of Classic and Contemporary Sans Serif Typography by De Jong, Cees W. and a great selection of related books, art and collectibles available now at AbeBooks.com.
data.text:
Soft Cover. Condition: Near Fine. No Jacket. First American Edition. Stiff card covers, stout 4to, pp.568. Illustrated. Text by Alison W Purvis. Near fine copy. A heavy book weighing c1750g when suitably parcelled, thus exceeding the default weight of 1000g for the postage quotation, and invoking a request for the extra postage at cost at time of order ( or can be supplied on request ) if to be sent overseas or by UK 1st class post Size: 4to - over 9Â¾" - 12" tall.

Hardcover. Condition: Good. First Edition. A dynamic visual record of typeface evolution, focusing on the last twenty years. The digital era has entirely transformed the world of typography. This elegant and easy-to-use book provides a comprehensively illustrated record of developments in the field, clearly setting them in their historical context and forming an essential reference for graphic designers everywhere.Creative Type begins with three essays that address issues such as the impact of the digital era on typography and the ways in which contemporary designers are harnessing the typefaces of the past to satisfy the needs of the present. The book goes on to illustrate thirty-four modern classic typefaces produced between 1985 and 2004, accompanied by comments from each font's designer. A section devoted to the great historic typefaces, from Garamond, created in 1543, to Akzidenz Grotesk, designed by Gunter Gerhard Lange in 1969, completes the volume. Illustrated in color and black and white.

Softcover. Condition: Good. First Edition. This complete international history of poster design from the Art Nouveau to the present covers all of the significant developments in poster design, and every important type of poster, from wine and war to rock and rebellion. One thousand posters illustrate the work of virtually every significant artist and graphic designer who ever created a memorable poster, including a generous selection of contemporary work. Organized chronologically, with thematic sections devoted to design styles as well as popular history, The Poster is also a visual chronicle of world culture from the late 19th century to the present. Finally, The Poster is an appealing design object in itself, and a terrific way to experience the pleasures of graphic design.

Hardcover. Condition: As New. No Jacket. 1st Edition. Text in English Language. Sturdy black linen covered slipcase with red leather over top and bottom and gilt title on the side, showing some wear, but still very neat. Two volumes bound in red textured leather ,no inscriptions, pages appear untouched. This is a heavy set and may incur additional postage charges, especially overseas.

Hardcover. Condition: Very Good. Dust Jacket Condition: Very Good. 1st Edition. Folio, cloth, dust jacket, 351pp., ills. First U.S. printing. VG+/VG: a clean, bright and sound book with a mild bump to the head of the spine; a clean and solid jacket but mild play at the edges and a touch of dust soiling. Extra postage will be asked (7).

Hardcover. Condition: Very Good. Dust Jacket Condition: Very Good. First Edition. First Edition, First Printing. Not price-clipped ($75.00 price intact). Published by Thames & Hudson, 2008. Folio. Black cloth boards stamped in silver. Book is very good; with no writing or names. Sharp corners, binding tight and pages crisp. Light spine lean and a few spots on top of page ends. Dust jacket is very good with light shelf wear. 350 pages. ISBN: 9780500513989. 100% positive feedback. 30 day money back guarantee. NEXT DAY SHIPPING! Excellent customer service. Please email with any questions or if you would like a photo. All books packed carefully and ship with free delivery confirmation/tracking. All books come with free bookmarks. Ships from Southampton, New York.

Hardcover. Condition: Very Good. Dust Jacket Condition: Very Good. 1st Edition. Blue printed boards. Folio. 392pp. Pictorial dust jacket. Piet Mondrian was one of the radically innovative artist of the 20th century. This book is a thoroughly visual narrative story, combining more than 240 superb color reproductions of the most important works with documentary images from the artist's life and biographical commentary. A very good copy with some light bumping to the top and bottom of the front cover near the spine. There is a small remainder dot at the bottom of the textblock else the text is fine and clean. The jacket is very good with some creasing at the top of the spine. Foreign postage extra on this heavy book.
